content.webTitle: Rugby league: Challenge Cup preliminary-round draw throws up all-Welsh tie

fields.headline: Challenge Cup draw throws up all-Welsh tie
fields.bodyText: There will be an all-Welsh tie in the preliminary round of the Carnegie Challenge Cup next month after Cardiff's University of Wales Institute were drawn against Valley Cougars, the Welsh Conference champions. The teams will have to win three games to have the chance of facing professional opposition at the third round stage in March, and a fourth if they are to tackle the third Welsh club in the competition, Celtic Crusaders, when the Super League clubs enter in April. The preliminary-round draw was seeded for the first time to separate the 48 amateur entrants from the game's traditional heartlands - 16 of whom have received a bye to the first round - from eight more unusual entrants including Leeds Metropolitan University, who have an away tie at Bristol Sonics. Carnegie Challenge Cup Preliminary Round ties Ovenden v Oulton Raiders; Skirlaugh v Heworth; Wath Brow Hornets v Millom; Siddal v Normanton Knights; Stanningley v Hull Dockers; Halifax Irish v Bradford Dudley Hill; Rochdale Mayfield v Leigh East; Halton Simms Cross v York Acorn; Ellenborough v Wigan St Patricks; Bank Quay Bulls v Queens; Oldham St Annes v Wigan St Judes; Widnes St Maries v Ince Rose Bridge; Shaw Cross Sharks v Castleford Lock Lane; Stanley Rangers v Leigh Miners Rangers; Eccles and Salford Juniors v Saddleworth Rangers; Egremont Rangers v Thornhill Trojans; Bristol Sonics v Leeds Met Carnegie; University of Wales Institute, Cardiff v Valley Cougars; Loughborough University v Nottingham Outlaws; West London Sharks v The Army
